rules: Rule1: If author W submitted paper Z, then paper Z is retracted.
Rule2: Provided that institution V investigated paper Z, if paper Z is not valid research, then paper Z is not plagiarized.
Rule3: Under the condition that journal X assigned an editor to paper Z, editor T made a decision on paper Z.
Rule4: Either journal X assigned an editor to paper Z or expert U was invited to review paper Z.
Rule5: If expert U was invited to review paper Z, then institution V investigated paper Z.
Rule6: Provided that editor T made a decision on paper Z, a revision was requested from author W for paper Z.
Rule7: If a revision was requested from author W for paper Z, then author W submitted paper Z.
Rule8: Whenever paper Z has minor issues, if paper Z is not valid research, then paper Z was corrected.
Rule9: Under the condition that paper Z has major issues, provided that paper Z is not valid research, paper Z was corrected.
Rule10: If journal X publishes research papers, then journal X has funding from a government grant.
Rule11: Either journal X publishes research papers or journal X is peer-reviewed.
Rule12: Assuming that author W made a formal appeal, author W filed an appeal.
Rule13: Either author W made a formal appeal or author W made an informal complaint.
Rule14: If author W is guilty, then author W is not cleared.
Rule15: Provided that author W is blacklisted, author W is banned.
Rule16: If journal X is peer-reviewed, then paper Y is accepted.
Rule17: Assuming that journal X is peer-reviewed, journal X has a rigorous process.
Rule18: Either a warning was issued to author W or author W is not banned.
Rule19: If institution V took no action against author W, then a warning was not issued to author W.
Rule20: Provided that paper Y is influential, paper Z is valid research.
Rule21: Whenever journal X has high impact, if paper Y is cited, then paper Y is influential.
Rule22: Either journal X is predatory or journal X has high impact.
Rule23: If journal X is legitimate, then journal X is not predatory.
Rule24: Provided that journal X is indexed properly, journal X is not predatory.
Rule25: If journal X follows guidelines, then journal X is ethical.
Rule26: Either journal X follows guidelines or journal X has a transparent process.
Rule27: Under the condition that journal X has a transparent process, journal X is indexed properly.
Rule28: Provided that paper Y is accepted, paper Y is cited.
Rule29: Provided that journal X is ethical, journal X is accredited.
Rule30: If journal X is recognized, then journal X is legitimate.
Rule31: Under the condition that journal X is accredited, journal X is recognized.
Rule32: Whenever journal X has a rigorous process, journal X uses blind review.
Rule33: If journal X uses blind review, then journal X is unbiased.
Rule34: Whenever journal X has fair evaluation, paper Z is valid research.
Rule35: Provided that journal X is unbiased, journal X has fair evaluation.

Rule36: If institution V opened an investigation on paper Z, then, if the absence of a decision by editor T implies submission by author W does not hold, editor T does not have a conflict of interest.
Rule37: Either institution V conducted a full investigation of paper Z or, if institution V did not open an investigation on paper Z, then institution V conducted a preliminary review of paper Z.
Rule38: Provided that evidence was found regarding paper Z, paper Z is not plagiarized.
Rule39: Either a committee was formed by institution V for paper Z or an expert was consulted by institution V for paper Z.
Rule40: Assuming that an expert was consulted by institution V for paper Z, if paper Z is not valid research, then evidence was found regarding paper Z.
Rule41: Whenever author W self-reported regarding paper Z, paper Z is retracted.
Rule42: Either author W self-reported regarding paper Z or a third party reported on paper Z.
Rule43: Assuming that journal X started processing paper Z, journal X conducted initial screening on paper Z.
Rule44: Provided that journal X conducted initial screening on paper Z, either author W submitted paper Z or institution V investigated paper Z.
Rule45: Whenever journal X is reputable, if paper Y is cited, then paper Z is valid research.
Rule46: Assuming that paper Z requires minor revisions, paper Z is conditionally accepted.
Rule47: Either paper Z requires minor revisions or paper Z requires major revisions.
Rule48: Provided that paper Z requires major revisions, if journal X completed the review of paper Z, then, whenever editor T made a decision on paper Z, author W submitted paper Z.
Rule49: Either author W made corrections to paper Z or author W submitted revisions for paper Z.
Rule50: Whenever author W submitted revisions for paper Z, if paper Z is not valid research, then paper Z was corrected.
Rule51: If paper Z was resubmitted, then, if the absence of corrections by author W implies that non-valid research leads to correction does not hold, author W did not miss the deadline for paper Z.
Rule52: Provided that paper Z is fast-tracked, paper Z was resubmitted.
Rule53: Either paper Z is fast-tracked or paper Z undergoes the normal process.
Rule54: Assuming that paper Z undergoes the normal process, paper Z was resubmitted.
Rule55: Whenever paper Z has format issues, if the absence of desk rejection implies rejection does not hold, then paper Z was rejected for technical reasons.
Rule56: Provided that paper Z violates length requirements, paper Z has style problems.
Rule57: If paper Z has a scope mismatch, then, if paper Z does not have format issues, paper Z violates length requirements.
Rule58: Assuming that paper Z needs translation, paper Z does not have language issues.
Rule59: Provided that paper Z breaches guidelines, resubmission is allowed for paper Z.
Rule60: Under the condition that journal X upheld the appeal for paper Z, journal X did not dismiss the appeal for paper Z.
Rule61: If it is not the case that a decision by editor T implies submission by author W, then editor T has a conflict of interest.
Rule62: Assuming that paper Z does not have minor issues or major issues, paper Z received a desk rejection.
Rule63: Whenever paper Z does not have minor issues or major issues, paper Z has language issues.
Rule64: Provided that paper Z does not have minor issues or major issues, paper Z needs translation.
Rule65: If the absence of an informal complaint by author W implying that non-issues lead to rejection does not hold, then institution V applied sanctions to author W.
Rule66: Provided that the absence of investigation completion implying that non-valid research and no ethical breach lead to misconduct does not hold, author W is cleared.
Rule67: Assuming that the absence of investigation completion implying that non-valid research and no ethical breach lead to misconduct does not hold, author W is guilty.
Rule68: If the absence of committee formation implying that non-valid research leads to evidence does not hold, then institution V closed the investigation on paper Z.
Rule69: Provided that the absence of third-party report implying that non-valid research leads to no plagiarism does not hold, no finding was made by institution V regarding paper Z.
Rule70: Assuming that the absence of corrections implying that non-valid research leads to correction does not hold, author W missed the deadline for paper Z.
Rule71: If it is not the case that either journal X reviewed the appeal for paper Z or policy violation implies guideline breach, then journal X dismissed the appeal for paper Z.

Rule72: Provided that the double negation of investigation completion implying that non-valid research and no ethical breach lead to misconduct not implying non-clearance holds, paper Z violates policy.

Rule73: Assuming that the double negation of investigation completion implying that non-valid research and no ethical breach lead to misconduct not implying non-clearance holds, resubmission is not allowed for paper Z.
Rule74: If journal X is not reputable, then author W is blacklisted.
Rule75: Assuming that journal X is not reputable, journal X is indexed.
Rule76: Whenever journal X is not reputable, journal X is not indexed.
Rule77: Assuming that paper Z does not have a scope mismatch, paper Z has an unsuitable topic.
Rule78: Provided that paper Z is not valid research, paper Z has an ethical breach.
Rule79: Assuming that paper Z is not valid research, paper Z is plagiarized.
facts: Fact1: Institution V completed the investigation of paper Z.
Fact2: Institution V took no action against author W.
Fact3: Journal X started processing paper Z.
Fact4: Journal X completed the review of paper Z.
Fact5: Journal X upheld the appeal for paper Z.
Fact6: Journal X does not have funding from a government grant.
Fact7: Paper Z was not corrected.
Fact8: Paper Z is not rejected.
Fact9: Author W did not file an appeal.
Fact10: Institution V did not apply sanctions to author W.
Fact11: Misconduct was not found in paper Z.
Fact12: Institution V did not conduct a preliminary review of paper Z.
Fact13: Institution V did not conduct a full investigation of paper Z.
Fact14: Institution V did not close the investigation on paper Z.
Fact15: It is not the case that no finding was made by institution V regarding paper Z.
Fact16: Paper Z is not conditionally accepted.
Fact17: Paper Z was not rejected for technical reasons.
Fact18: Paper Z does not have style problems.
Fact19: Paper Z does not have an unsuitable topic.
Fact20: Journal X did not review the appeal for paper Z.
Fact21: Paper Z is not retracted.
